magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
As a established and respected member of a guild, you can count on certain advantages that membership provides. Your fellow guild members will provide you with lodging and food if necessary, and pay for your funeral if need be. In some cities and towns, a guildhall offers a central location to meet with other members of your profession, which can be a good place to meet potential patrons, allies, or mercenaries.

Guilds often wield considerable political power. If you are accused of a crime, your guild will support you if a good case can be made for your innocence or if the crime is justifiable. You can also gain access to powerful political figures through the guild, if you are a member in good standing. Such connections may require the donation of money or magical items to the guild's coffers.

You must pay dues of 5 gp per month to the guild. If you miss payments, you must make up the back dues to stay in good standing with the guild.
